website_summaries.verdict: Value-priced, "entry level" 2-bike rack that's best for infrequent use.
cons: Some issues with clamp and strap breakage
Mounting concerns for smaller bikes and possible damage to vehicle

customer_reviews.title: Scratched the heck out of my new car
customer_reviews.text: Rotten product. This rack scratched the crap out of my black 2014 Honda Accord. I was very careful to install correctly and have plenty of experience with bike racks, yet one of the lower foam pads split straight up the middle during my 200 mile drive from Phoenix to LA making it so that the metal rack was rubbing straight onto my car's surface. Hollywood Rack's defective padding single handedly cost me nearly $1,000 in resurfacing and paint on my less than 1 year old car. This is a rotten product. Unless your car is already dented and scratched or you don't mind spending thousands of dollars to repair your vehicle, keep looking for an alternative mode of bike transport.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Ehsani

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit "most cars" as claimed
customer_reviews.text: "Fits most cars" is not true. There is a list of cars in the instructions and seems like maybe it works with like 50% of cars. Does not work with my car or my boyfriend's so we are going to have to return it which is a real hassle. And now we don't have a bike rack for our trip. I'm very disappointed. They should publish their list in the product info.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Strozier

customer_reviews.title: ... first because of some of the reviews but im glad i made this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical at first because of some of the reviews but I'm glad i made this purchase! And for those that say it doesn't fit 3 adult bikes you must be doing something wrong. I put a 29 and (2) 26 inch bikes with no problem and no scratching of the car by the bikes. I did purchase the crossbar adapters for my wife's and daughter's bikes to be able to set them on mount..I'm very happy i chose this!
customer_reviews.author: Elving F.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Perfectly on my PRIUS, I'm Happy.
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, and within 15 minutes it was ready to be used on my car. Comes with all the tie down straps to keep 2 bikes secure. However, the little metal end clips on the tie down straps look like they might dig in to your paint, so I wedged a piece of fabric in between to prevent any scratching to my car. So far, it all works quite well. The quality is excellent, and it should last a long time. Excellent Value for the price. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from Sunny Florida

customer_reviews.title: best value bike rack you can get.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second hollywood rake, my first fit only 2 bikes. I tried another vendor that was a little cheaper and when I got that rake, my bikes did not fit it. I returned it and then ordered the hollywood rake.I do not have the "normal" straight bar across that most bikes have, and the strapping system on this rack works perfectly. It fits all 3 of my vehicles and is very rugged. Spend the few extra bucks and get this, you wont regret it...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Our first trip was a success. We took a gamble and ordered this rack, knowing that a 2012 Mini Cooper isn't fully compatible. After our first trip, I can say this rack does work with a Mini Cooper. If you have large 2 bikes, I suggest you get the 3 bike mount for extra space. Two adult mountain/hybrid bikes will fill up the space for 3 bikes very quickly. Be sure to pick up some extra bungee cords to secure wheels and whatever else. Check and double check all straps every chance you get especially if you're travelling far.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Carrier except for Locking Straps to Car
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble to put on car. This rack can not fit 3 bikes on it. Can carry 2 no problem. The one big problem I have with it, which gives it 2 stars is the straps that attach to the car do not lock in place and become very loose on short journeys. It has 6 locking straps, in which 4 work great, but 2 will not stay locked in place and become loose. I am afraid the carrier will fall off the car. Outside of the straps, the carrier does the job. May return at this point if I can't get these two straps to lock.
customer_reviews.author: John Gennardo

customer_reviews.title: I recommend using a bungee cord from the wheels through the ...
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile to set up, but I was able to get three adult bikes on, and they stayed in place. I wish the attachment points were not so difficult to open and close, but I guess that makes them more secure when you're driving. For this and any similar bike rack, I recommend using a bungee cord from the wheels through the bike frame of each bike. This keeps the front wheel from flopping back and forth, and keeps the wheels from spinning while you're driving.
customer_reviews.author: sugar cookie

customer_reviews.title: Decent investment.
customer_reviews.text: So far the rack has worked well to carry two adult bikes, but it's tricky to fit them on together. I can't see how a third bike could possibly fit. Be careful that parts of the bike aren't rubbing or banging up against your trunk. The best part - I didn't not have to tighten the straps at all. They remained secure for the trip 500 miles round trip, with several days of camping and some rain too.
customer_reviews.author: luke fanning

customer_reviews.title: Straps fall off
customer_reviews.text: I went against all of the whiney reviews and purchased this product anyway. Well I now agree since I can not drive 10 miles with my Nissan Sentra or xterra without the straps coming off. So frequently in fact that I had to use my old bike rack to drive to NC for vacation. It received two stars because of the ease of the rubber straps to secure the bikes to the bike rack but that doesnt really help if your bikes are in four lanes of I95 traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, dependable, fits SUV
customer_reviews.text: This mount is so sturdy. I mounted it on the back of my 2019 GMC Acadia. I was worried that it might have issues mounting to the rear of an SUV but I’ve driven hours with 2-3 bikes on the back with no issues. The only thing I would add would be for the seller to provide clips/bands for the slack on the straps because the slack just flies in the wind, but I just tied the rest down to the rack. Other than that, great rack!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy light carrier
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and light. You don't need a super heavy steel rack to have a 20 lb bike. This is is a 3 bike carrier and it's well built. Runner and straps are of quality materials. Just don't know if it will stand the elements rd because i don't i tend to take it out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie de Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews I selected this rack. I had wanted a 4 bike trunk rack but settled for this 3 bike rack because of the reviews I read. Very satisfied with this rack. Installed quickly and easily on the car. Drove 800 miles (twice) on I - 80 and the rack was solid. Retainers held bikes securely although I do use bungee cords for extra security. They were not really needed. Clips did not damage car and supports did not damage car finish.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Fits on mustangs!
customer_reviews.text: This fits a 2010 Ford Mustang with spoiler. (The base spoiler that comes with the premium model car, I do not know about the raised spoilers that some GTs have. I searched all over looking for a bike rack that would fit a mustang with a spoiler. Almost all of the websites indicated that they would NOT fit a mustang with a spoiler but I did some digging and found some customers saying that this one would...and they were right! This carries 2 adult bikes. It can be a little tight to get the second bike on there, depending on the type of handlebars you have. Make sure you tighten and tie all the straps AFTER loading the bike on.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little cheap/unsteady but you really just have to get over your fears and let this thing do it's job. If you want something super sturdy and solid...it's gonna cost you more. It didn't scratch the car at all or shift very much, and my bikes made it the 400 miles without any incident. For the price it gets the job done. -Would recommended bungees/rope to tie the wheels and pedals down. They tend to spin from wind power at higher speeds. -Also would recommend putting something soft over the pedals as they can protrude and scratch car. Use a pair of old socks to slide right over each pedal, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great, Inexpensive Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack works like a charm. The other reviewers are correct about the potential of scratches on the back of your car if you're not careful, so just be careful. For long distance trips just put towels beneath where the rack contacts your trunk lid, and be careful that the two bottom strap pulleys don't scratch the shiz out of the back of your trunk like they did to mine. If you are mindful that they're there, and make sure they don't scrape as you're putting the rack on, they'll never be an issue. Great rack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Received this rack on time and in perfect condition. I had never used a bike rack before and even though this rack came with instructions I simply looked at it and could easily see how it was supposed to mount to the trunk of my Hyundai Sonata sedan and went ahead and put it on and immediately placed my bike upon it and went on my trip! Nice and solid and should last for many years. A very good value for the money and I am extremely pleased with the ease of use of this rack. Goes on and comes off in a few minutes. Sorry I didn't purchase this sooner and would recommend to anyone driving a family sedan.
customer_reviews.author: Silver fox

customer_reviews.title: I need HELP! 😫
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I bought this rack primarily to carry around my 26” mountain bike. I was able to successfully assemble the rack and mount it onto my car; the problem I’m having is that the built-in “triangle” on my bike’s frame — you know, the “hole” in the middle where you allow the bike to rest on the rack — is absolutely TINY (see attached pictures). Now I’m completely baffled as to how to — or IF I even can — safely put my bike onto this particular bike rack. Any suggestions, anyone?? 😩
customer_reviews.author: Pdiddy20

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT product, not enough warning for scratched/chipped paint...
customer_reviews.text: It's excellent for my bike but has chipped off so much paint from of my car, hence the 3 stars. It came without instructions but after emailing the company they sent me to the site to watch the video. EXTREMELY easy to install. I feel safe driving with my bike now. Just realllllllly wish I knew how it would chip my paint. I had put protection around certain areas but scratching/chipping was way more than expected. If you buy it's a great product just safeguard your car, for your own sake.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product for bikers without bumper hitch racks
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product for bikers without bumper hitch racks. Fully adjustable and easily mounted to most vehicle types makes this product a must have. Though I do have a couple of concerns, first make sure the rubber straps that hold the bike in place are correctly stretched, too lose and a sudden jarring movement will cause them to pop off and the bike may be released. Second, make sure all holding straps are fastened to the vehicle correctly or vehicle movement and bouncing may cause straps to come loose and start banging all over your nice paint job.
customer_reviews.author: Latinhorseman

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely on 2005-2014 Xterras.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid rack. Comes fully assembled right out of the box. The main reason I'm writing a review is to let anyone with a 2005-14 Xterra that this will work nicely, if the bottom rubber bumpers on the rack lie on the rear step as shown. It took a few minutes of finagling to get it right, but it's very secure now.
customer_reviews.author: Inquisitive

customer_reviews.title: The straps that anchor the rack to my car did ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps that anchor the rack to my car did not hold; had to tie knots to keep it from slipping off the one time I tried to use this. The "teeth" slip and the rack slid down to rest on the rear wipers. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spessert

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet, but fit is perfect on my husband's 2015 Chysler 200 and my 2008 Subaru Legacy. Seems like it will hold up for quite a while, metal pieces instead of plastic. Just what we needed, and the price was right. Update: Used this on an hour drive and loaded a third bike onto it before arriving at our final destination. It held up well and stayed solid! Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MaGoo007

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set-up and use bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike rack to move across the country, and I couldn't be happier with it. It was very easy to adjust and fit to my car, and my road bike was very stable with the straps that come with the rack. I added a little section of a pool noodle for padding for the bottom bar, but I don't think it was really necessary. The only thing I am not sure will age well are the spring clips that allow for easy and quick adjustments, but if that becomes an issue I'll come back and update my review. Until then I couldn't be happier with a bike rack that didn't break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to mount bike rack
customer_reviews.text: My dad helped me adjust the straps but after ... it’s incredibly easy to mount and un-mount. The straps are going to be super long so if you can cut it and seal the ends it will be ideal! It’s a very sturdy device. I got the one for two bikes and it works perfect and it won’t damage your car paint.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: If you don't want to scrach your car, dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: the rubber on the metal piece that goes on your trunk is very minimum. It scratched my car. all the nuts and bolts should be covered with rubbers as well, there are pockey screws and nuts all over. A perfect recipe to scratch your car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Held my bikes very securely on a 2000+ mile road trip.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to take 2 bikes from southern California to Portland, Oregon and back. It worked beautifully. Held the bikes nice and secure. I checked the straps every time I stopped, but they were never loose. While up there, I added a third bike and took them all to the Oregon coast. It's a little tricky with 3, but it works fine. This was on a minivan, by the way. I was a little concerned because the booklet that came with it said it works with minivans but they don't recommend this model. The one they suggested was twice the price, so I figured I'd try it out first. It worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not great, When you tighten the bike rack down
customer_reviews.text: Not great, When you tighten the bike rack down, the bike supports spread too wide and make it VERY hard to get on your bike. The rubber closures are crap, they hold well but you have to bang up your hands each time you fix your bike.
customer_reviews.author: ahventure

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack
customer_reviews.text: We bought this same rack 6 yrs ago, it took a beating and held up great. The nylon straps were the first thing that gave out then the joints rusting because we live by the beach, but NO complaints. The only thing that could improve is the rubber straps that stretch across the bikes are too stiff for me (a woman) to manage, my boyfriend is fine with them. I'm very happy with this rack, the quality and price is well worth the investment. It holds 2 really heavy cruisers securely.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Prius V
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of bike racks with all the straps and stuff, but I now understand having 6 straps attached to the car is a good thing. I haven't put 3 bikes on, but it fits 2 perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Meanjoe4202

customer_reviews.title: ... five star because so far we are very well pleased. We live on a rural
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this a five star because so far we are very well pleased. We live on a rural, nonstate maintained dirt road so I was concerned about how well this product would hold our bikes on the way out, but it did great. We wiped my car off before putting the rack on to make sure there were no scratches left behind, which I recommend everyone should do, and there weren't any.
customer_reviews.author: Leatha H.

customer_reviews.title: a great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: We use this bike rack every week. Often have to take it off and put it on several times in the day so we can get into the trunk for picnics etc. Easy to manage, holds the bike steady in highway conditions.
customer_reviews.author: mch

customer_reviews.title: Love it, recommended 💯
customer_reviews.text: Love my rack. Second time I buy this rack, the first one survived 4 years, many trips, beating, rain it was time to change it for a new one. I mean is great that I'm buying it for second time, it is light easy to mount. Recommend 💯!
customer_reviews.author: CGCH

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I use to have bike rack from Thule few years ago, it was just disappear after moving my house. Thule one was hard to assemble put a part very difficult to install so I remember that my friend came over and did install for me. I want to bike ride where the bike path right by the ocean so I need bike rack again so I found Hollywood racks from amazon. I tried today and I love this bike rack. I don't need assemble any part, super easy to install. worth to money and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Olive jiho Rhee

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in 2011 and it is still holding up well in 2018!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to put on your car and easy to put on up to 3 bikes. I've done long road trips with 3 bikes on it, and it holds up well, even after all these years. You can rest assure that your bikes are safe and secure if fastened properly.
customer_reviews.author: SMO

customer_reviews.title: The bike rack itself worked great. I felt comfortable installing it on my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: The bike rack itself worked great. I felt comfortable installing it on my vehicle, a 2011 VW Golf TDI. The materials used felt sturdy and the straps seems that they would last. My only issue was that my bike was a smaller size, I'm 5' 4'', The posts that held the bike, were to wide to go through the center of the bike to hold it in place. I ended up returning it to fit smaller bikes. So for taller folks, this bike rack is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Not really the best for long distance moving
customer_reviews.text: I used this to bring two bikes from Las Vegas to Kansas City. One of the rubber straps fell off about 1000 miles in. I had to secure it with several other straps/bungees/tie wires to ensure that the bikes did not move at all during transport. It's cheap which is nice, but it's also a pretty cheaply built thing. I wish the rubber strap didn't break, and the safety strap really doesn't tie down securely.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted in a bike rack on the cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well! Good function for price for sure. I have carried two bikes at the same time with this no problem. Fits my Hyundai Elantra 2013 great. I have driven 70mph+ on the highway with the two bikes as well no problems. The strings are a little long for my car so i tie them up to shorten them I'm sure you could also just cut them to fit your needs. I use them to tie the wheels down so they don't move. I have a very large bike and the second bike is a small road bike. I have not tried to use this with a "female" frame bike, not sure if it will work for those!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A

customer_reviews.title: Works on my Subaru Impreza
customer_reviews.text: Great price and very simple way to mount a bike on the back of a sedan. I use it on my 2001 Subaru Impreza sedan. The bar that sits on top of the trunk doesn't quite touch the trunk lid, because I have the RS spoiler on the trunk that gets in the way. So it would be nice if the top bar was a little longer to get over smaller spoilers like mine, but with the workaround it still works. Definitely a good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H

customer_reviews.title: It Works but...
customer_reviews.text: scratched my car to hell. You need like support under where it touches your car. Luckily it’s an old car. Drove it over 2,000 miles with a fat tire bike on the back though.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It took a really long time to get it adjusted ...
customer_reviews.text: It took a really long time to get it adjusted properly to the car... The bikes have the bar that slants so it is difficult to put them on. Took a really really really long time to finally get both bikes on... May still purchase the crossbar for easier loading on the bikes... when I load the bikes now, I am crushing cables and handlebars and the pedal is digging into the spokes of the other bike. May look for a bike rack that allows for easier fit...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avid Bike Rider
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this rack, it has paid dividends for my health and overall quality of life. I live in Central New Jersey and it is not a good idea to ride my bike in traffic. Therefore, I purchased this rack and I can go to trails, parks, scenic views etc. I currently owned a Honda Civic 2006 LX, the fit is perfect. However, I would use only two bikes instead of the advertised 3 bikes. I am well pleased with this purchase and I had it for over 4 years now without any incidents.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: 000 miles with this rack and it worked out great. A few notes
customer_reviews.text: I drove about 5,000 miles with this rack and it worked out great. A few notes, my Carolla has a spoiler which I had to remove to use the rack. The places where the rubbery pads rest against your car should be kept clean to avoid any scratching. The 2 vertical bars that rise from the trunk made some contact on my car so I had to improvise some pads to prevent scratching. The rack is sturdy and did a great job once I made those changes.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great rack at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack for the price. It is fairly easy to attach and holds bike securely. The materials that comprise the rack and sturdy and the padding is good. It is best when use for just one bike, as two bikes with touch and bang together, so plan on using some old socks to limit any rubbing when carrying two bikes. I purchased two of these so far. Got the first one for my daughter and she uses it a lot. Then got another one for my other daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl K.

customer_reviews.title: Well made bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Works well for Nissan Altima and is very easy to put on and be ready to go. Carried 2 bike without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Louann Flitton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. It's easy to mount and dismount from both my wife and my car. We used it to take our two bikes on a vacation recently (driving from PA to NC) with no problems. Straps pull tight to prevent the bikes from swaying and the I use the additional strap to prevent the wheels from spinning while we drive.
customer_reviews.author: MJG

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, 2 bikes are snug and safe on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, 2 bikes are snug and safe on the back our car. But the 4 soft foam pads will damage the paint on your car. Even when I wet wiped the car before mounting to make sure there was no sand or other dirt on the trunk touch areas. For us, our car is old, so we do not mind. We know hitch mounting racks cost much more, so for this price this is a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: Coen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rack at this price point
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't go wrong with this rack. It fights most vehicles (my Chrysler 300 and Subaru Outback work fine) and holds 3 bikes no problem. I was a little worried on the first trip, but now I don't even think about it. Like anything you put on your car, there's always a risk for damage. This is built well but bikes on your car and clips (although rubberized) on your trunk can cause damage. If you LOVE your car and want it perfect, I would not put a rack like this on it. Get the hitch (and pay the money).
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a bad one but that was my experience
customer_reviews.text: My issue is that the straps became lose and undone after tightening. I drove about 10 miles and when I go to my destination the tightened straps were so lose that I flicked the hooks off the car with ease. Maybe I got a bad one but that was my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Snacks

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: It is very nice rack, but the bikes do not fit very well. You have to spend very long time to fit them in the holder parts.
customer_reviews.author: No Way

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up; sturdy
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in title: It's easy to set up and holds up well. I drive all over the place with my bike. One of the bike grips did move position (didn't fall or anything, and when I tried to move it back, it was stuck in the new position very solidly; had to get ye olde hex key out to move it back), but this was after I had literally left my bike in that same grip for like a week. So, you know, don't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Crinkly Whizzledink

customer_reviews.title: Not Responsable for Damages!!!
customer_reviews.text: I almost caused an accident. bike fell off on rack at 60 miles per hour. the thick rubber strap broke. And bike was hanging by single emerg. Strap it comes with. I could not believe it. After that scare i would spend extra money in order not to cause an accident in the street. The only way to use this rack. Drive under 50 mph and buy a chain/cover w plastic and secure the heck out of it. I tried to return it but a few days over the 30 day return policy.
customer_reviews.author: HemiPower

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and all i use this for my 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and all i use this for my 2 bikes , no problem with them . Can carry with my SUBARU Imprezza , recommended ! Love this
customer_reviews.author: Why Ch

customer_reviews.title: Strong rack reasonable priced
customer_reviews.text: Strong rack that has good attachments. The horizontal brackets are a bit to wide for most bikes, so you have to "walk" the bike onto the rack. Easy to install and remove. The rubber retaining straps are too stiff and difficult to stretch over the frame and hook. For short trips at low speed, the retaining straps are not needed.
customer_reviews.author: mtcworld

customer_reviews.title: good product but a little on the short side
customer_reviews.text: this product is very good. I will not give it a "great" because it is too short. You can get only two bikes on it. Don't even try 3 bikes because it isn't going to happen. but I like it because it is made in the USA, solid material, and it carries one or two bikes very well. The bikes stay in place and move very little. Very secure. I would not have a problem loading this rack with one of my expensive bikes and going on a road trip. make sure you buy an adapter if you have a "female" bike or a bike with no top tube or you will be doing some fancy bike mounting :)
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy set up. Once in place, the rack is very stable and the bikes remain securely mounted. We managed to squeeze 4 bikes on for a weekend trip. Did not have any problems. Some tips: Arrange the arms to be as far out as possible so that the bike pedals don't scratch the pain on the trunk. Remember to tie up the loose ends of the straps after you've installed the rack; we forgot to do so on the way back and shredded the ends of the straps by dragging them on the road for 200 miles! Use the extra strap lengths to tie down the front wheels/handlbars so they stay in one place.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy rack
customer_reviews.text: I loved this rack... I used it to carry my 28 lb bike on a 1600 mi. trip and it worked perfectly.. I took the bike down two or three times so it wouldn't be outside when I stayed at a hotel but other than that I didn't need to do any adjustments (though at the beginning I was checking the straps constantly to make sure they wouldnt get loose). I haven't tried it with two bikes yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad so far
customer_reviews.text: Not Bad so far! I've owned it a few days. It was easy to put on and easy to remove. It feels sturdy and well-built. Although I did notice with some disappointment - possibly even surprise - that it said "made in China". Which to me screams "poor quality import made with possible sub-standard components". Regardless of that, it seems like a well-built rack. Will update this review if something changes my opinion drastically.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy and adaptable
customer_reviews.text: Looked through reviews, checked out product website as recommended in reviews....search and found my SUV adaptable to all Hollywood Racks. Bought this one and drove 300 miles (freeway and mtn switchbacks) with NO PROBLEMS at all. We did stop and check everything about 100 miles in and nothing was out of sorts. We had this rack loaded with 2 adult hybrids and a trailer bike for our 4yrs old. Followed manufacturers directions and it went great for our trip, there and back. Loved it, recommended it already.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli J. Slager

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2006 Honda Civic Coupe Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2006 Honda Civic coupe. Fits perfectly on my car. It's sturdy and well made. Only con might be the extra length of the cords for the hooks. But nothing that some zip ties can't fix. I haven't tried to fit two bikes yet but it's definitely made for two. Although it may get tight. Side note: You will probably want some bungee cords to keep the bike pedals and tires from moving so as not to scratch your bumper. This is the case with any trunk mount bike rack, however, and not specific to this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The rack worked exactly as stated. We were able to put three bikes on, but it took a little bit of time and maneuvering to figure out the best way to load them. We travelled about 4 hours each way and had no difficulty whatsoever. We took it off when we weren't using it, but it was easy to put back on. The rack is sturdy and caused no damage to our vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: LTUCF

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars only because I think it is a bit heavy. This rack is easier and quicker to mount on my trunk than the older Allen rack it replaced. The mechanism for locking the arms is fantastic. I hooked the straps to holes on the underside of the the trunk lid so there is no possibility of the clips scratching the car paint. Have only used it once but was expecting it to take me a long time to set up and I was done in under 10 minutes. Would recommend it as being a very good rack in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: that works for me
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A TOYOTA COROLLA SEDAN AND A HONDA CRV. THIS RACK IS REALLY GOOD ON MY SEDAN BECAUSE THE PEDAL GOES ABOVE THE TRUNK AND DOESN'T HIT THE CAR, BUT ONCE I TRIED IT ON MY CRV AND I HAD TO COVER THE PEDAL BECAUSE IT WAS SO CLOSE TO THE BACK DOOR THAT WOULD SCRATCH THE DOOR. TOTALLY ITS A GOOD RACK AND I COULD PUT 3 BIKES ON IT, (1)26" & (1)24" MOUNTAIN BIKES AND (1) 18" KIDS BIKE. DON'T FORGET TO RE-TIGHT ALL THE ROPES AFTER LOADING THE BIKES ON THE RACK. I HAVE NOT TRIED IT IN LONG DISTANCES AND I HAVE NO IDEA IF IT CAN TAKE THAT LONG WITHOUT BEING LOOSEN.
customer_reviews.author: H. Edraki

customer_reviews.title: Good rack when used properly.
customer_reviews.text: If you follow directions and secure bike with strap it holds up very well. I drove 600 miles and never had to adjust straps. I recommend you wrap the strap slack with a zip tie or other tie to keep them from flying around in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: saibian

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I put it on my Cadillac CTS. The trunk comes to a point in the middle of the two pieces of foam along the top of the bumper, but I put another piece of rubber on that spot, and no more rubbing issues. Fits very securely!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a rack that would move me across the country, and this rack did just that. It got my bike where it needed to go without damaging the car or bike. I read the reviews prior and was worried about my paint scratching or rubbing, so I did wrap the base in towels, which worked, althought I am not sure it was really required. The only issue that was there (and I not sure that this was not user error) is that after day 2 the rack began to sag, and it just needed to be hung higher. I have a 2011 Honda CRV, and this device worked swimingly. Best bang for my buck, can;t beat $64.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were more stable. They made it seem as though you can just push it into an upright position when not in use, but that loosens the starps, you have to redo/tighten the, and then redo tighen them to use again, so it is easier to just take it off and put it back on when needed. While in use I leave it down and just hope no one hits it. Other than that holds 1 adult and 2 kids bikes well. interested to see if it will hold 3 adult bikes when they get older.
customer_reviews.author: La India

customer_reviews.title: Good rack, solid build
customer_reviews.text: After lots of shopping around found nothing else even remotely comparable for the price. Initial setup took about 20 minutes but I am sure I can cut that down to 10 or so for next time. The foam bumpers protected the car well. Only real gripe is that there are no instructions, or even beginner tips to mounting the rack included. Just have to figure it out from the pictures on the outside of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Maniora

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Honda.
customer_reviews.text: I sold my SUV that I could but my bike inside, and need a rack for my Honda . I saw a Hollywood rack on a car in the parking lot near the bike trail, and it looked very sturdy. The E3 express 6 strap mount is very secure on the trunk of my Honda Accord . The only issue I have is a single bike will rock back and forth when you accelerate and brake. I was able to resolve this with a piece of tube and a bungee cord.( I only carry a single bike on the last mount).
customer_reviews.author: j-rock

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it since two years without any problem, initially when I bought a van and had had only two bikes now I have a ford fiesta sedan and I have three bikes, with two years of use has not rusted and got wet in the rain on several sometimes very easy to install in the car, I have not even scratched the paint of the car but I have the precaution to clean before putting it in the car also I protect with two clean disposable towels.
customer_reviews.author: gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Nice affordable rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack gets the job done. I mostly use it for local trips (under 10 miles) so I can't speak to its performance over long distances, but for what I do it's perfect. Getting it set up each time can be a bit tedious, and the center rack-to-bike strap usually comes loose, but other than that no real complaints. It scratched up my trunk paint the first time I used it because I didn't offset it from the car enough, definitely be careful about that. Considering the price of most bike racks out there, this is a VERY good buy for your money at less than half the price of others.
customer_reviews.author: beema

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy......great value!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect two-bike rack. Easily attached to my 2013 Camry se sedan.
customer_reviews.author: TechNut

customer_reviews.title: Having second thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was quick. Unit was easy to hook up but seems a bit insecure. I haven't given it a road test yet but am going to test with one of my clunker bicycles. A bit uncertain about trusting a 2K+ bicycle to it. One other thought is mountain bikes with "fat" tubes don't sit in the rubber cradles very well. In my heart I wish I would have spent more money on a Thule.
customer_reviews.author: naturelover

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfactory Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: The product lived up to the reviews I read and research I did on it. It mounts on the trunk of my 2007 Honda Civic sedan with no trouble and is very stable and secure. I really doubt it can be used for three bikes, but two should be doable (I use it for only one bike). I have a double suspension mountain bike, and purchased the adaptor (also made by Hollywood) that was recommended, but found that the bike fits just fine on the rack without an adaptor (your bike may be different).
customer_reviews.author: Alfa_Romeo_fan

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, secure fit, but won't fold down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mazda CX-7, and it fits very well. The booklet specifically says it will NOT fit that model, but it easily does. I'll try to post some pics. The one issue I have is that once attached it will NOT fold down out of the way when not carrying bikes. You have to loosen all the straps and remove it, fold it down, and stow it out of the way. It's a shame you can't have it all! But otherwise this is a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: Great strong product! I used it to transport my motorized bike (which is pretty darn heavy) and it helped out a lot! Just wish it would come with some ties or clamps to secure the access straps flopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work as Promised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it seemed best for my car, a Mazda 3 Hatchback. The advertisements said it would work. It will not as the top hinge space on the car is too narrow and will not accept the clips. Unfortunately, events prevented me from trying it out for 7 weeks, which means I cannot return.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Willmott

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best budget bike rack that you could get. The rubber that holds the bike is thick and holds the bikes securely. The straps are very long, which is good if you have a hatch back or SUV. I have personally trimmed the straps to make the lengths easier to deal with, but that is personal preference. I actualyl bought this one as a gift for a friend after using my current one for several years. For the money, you will not get a better truck mount bike rack.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Hollywood Racks E3 Express 3 Bike Model....Absolutely Great!
customer_reviews.text: I relocated to another city from Michigan....and drove with my bike securely attached to the Hollywood Rack E3 Express (3 bike model as my wife and I will use it). Not a vibration or movement of any type...during 11 hour trip....through driving rain, winds, etc...at speeds in excess of 70 mph....consistently. Cannot say enough about how satisfied I am... Great value for the $$ But be sure to use extra bunggie cords to secure bike(s) in addition to those provided by mfr.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph E. Whitmire

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit many cars, check before buying
customer_reviews.text: When buying this Rack I assumed (judging by the description) that it can fit any car, including my Toyota Prius. Unfortunately, it did not; I discovered only in the manual that I would need a different model for my car. Now I cannot find how to return or exchange this rack. They should have made it clear in the description that this model does not fit many cars
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up on my vehicle and held the bike on it securely. It fit just fine on my 2009 Escape. No scratching issues, and no danger of it even though the bike was in the inside holder closest to the car. If you have a woman's bike, or a bike without a crossbar, you will need to get an adapter to use this holder. No big deal though. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ACDCJen

customer_reviews.title: Check your frame and tube sizes first
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. I tried it on 3 different 48cm frames. Two were an extremely tight fit, and one didn't fit at all; the rack's cradles (the little round slots made for the top tubes to rest inside and strap into) didn't fit my road bike that has wider tubes (a CAAD10, 2015 model). Also, it may have been my fault somehow, but the rack chipped the paint on my trunk. I did do my best to follow the manual's installation instructions carefully, so that was a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used from Amazon. It was brand new but repackaged. What a value. I can take my two kids bikes and mine when ever we go for a trip to ride. I had to cut the straps as they are very long, but now it takes less then five minutes from setup to travel. I bought bungee cords to keep the wheels straight, You can't beat this rack for the money or convenience.
customer_reviews.author: stu

customer_reviews.title: works better with just 1 bike
customer_reviews.text: The biggest drawback to this is if you dont pay attention and be very careful, you WILL scratch your car. The bikes and the peddles will come in contact with your trunk, especially if you arent familiar with bike racks. Also, 2 bikes on this is a bit of a stretch, works better with just 1 bike. Other than that, its been durable so far
customer_reviews.author: J. Webber

customer_reviews.title: It worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: We just got back from our trip which covered over 2000 miles. We had this bike rack strapped on the back of our Pontiac Montana van the whole way. We had none of the problems that a few others mentioned about the straps coming loose etc. In fact, just the opposite, the rack was secure the whole way. We had to manipulate the three bikes to fit on the rack but that was no big deal. The bikes rode great. I was very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Northland

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: Fits all my cars (a Ford Focus and Ford Fusion) perfectly and holds my wife's and my bicycles securely. My son is even able to use it on his Ford Focus and it has a small spoiler. Very easy to put on and take off. The only downfall about this is that you can not use your trunk while it is on your car.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: This thing went on easy, seems durable, and it carried my two large bikes without issue for 20 hours of driving hooked up to my Toyota Yaris. Price seemed reasonable at Amazon. What else can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Clay Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a friend's expensive bike rack before I purchased this. Compared to that one, this is slightly harder to install. But it works just as well. Use it for my Giant rove 3 bike on my 2013 Elantra. It unnerved me a little that I could not fit both the clasps on the top tube but It holds better with the clamps on the top tube and the back stay. Havent used two bikes with it yet so cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: RIN

customer_reviews.title: I didn't seem to find the list of cars it fit.
customer_reviews.text: I like the bike rack, great price, its sturdy, etc. The only problem as of right now is that it doesn't fit my car.. I drive a 2010 Legacy, it is not on the list, but I looked for a list prior to buying this and didn't seem to find it, that is the reason for the low review. It is a good product if you can get it to fit your car. Oh and its making due for now.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Rack holds well
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to put the rack on the window because of the wiper. There is no real stress on the window. The result of putting it below the window on my Odyssey I had to take the front wheel off because it was too close to the road.. I use a hitch rack when I travel and stay in risky places. Theft is harder with a hitch rack. This rack would have to be taken off and put indoors where theft might occur..
customer_reviews.author: Emmet

customer_reviews.title: Good mounting Rack- But ladies bike, be aware.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on my Honda accord and didnt really realize it until later that its difficult to mount a ladies bike on it because of the bent frame shape. I had to mount the bike in a weird position so that the rack could hold it. Might be a little tight for 2 bikes to be mounted side-by-side. So, for anyone who plans to mount a ladies bike on it, be careful before you buy. Other, than that, the rack is full iron and has good build quality. Good mounting instructions made my job easier.
customer_reviews.author: NikNak

customer_reviews.title: bike rack
customer_reviews.text: The instructions did come in spanish, but other then that it was fine. I watched a youtube video that helped me put it on. It does the job for being cheaper then others and was easy to take on and off once we figured it out. I wouldn't have wanted to spend a bunch of money on an expensive one when we don't use it too often. Someday soon we will get more use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: raneata lemke

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great. I have a hatchback car and was worried ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I have a hatchback car and was worried that I would have trouble installing it but the straps are very long and everything worked out fine. I love it and I've had it for years.
customer_reviews.author: A Harris

customer_reviews.title: Made it 2000 miles no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before moving from the California coast to southern Texas. Used it on the back of an 83 Mercedes. Also used it around town on a 2004 Toyota Matrix. No complaints it works great. Made it the 2000 miles without any problems, nothing came loose, and everything was kept tight! My only complaint is there is no way we could have put 3 full sized bikes on there. 2 fit snuggly
customer_reviews.author: AP123

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It is a very well made bike rack, looks good was very easy to install. I have one full/large size bike which I am able to mount and move easily. I would have given it full five stars; the rack mounnting tie down straps are very long so I had to make a trip to the hardware store to purchase some velcro tie straps to roll and secure the extra length. With that done it has become an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product
customer_reviews.text: I like this bike rack but sometimes it takes a little while longer to set this rack on the back of your vehicle. In the future I am considering buying the bike rack which hooks into the tow under the back bumper. The back tow bike rack still gives you access to your trunk if needed, this bike rack blocks that access. Overall, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I purchased this bike rack! I needed one to carry at least 2 bikes but wanted to be prepared for 3 yet not spend an arm and a leg. After watching the video, this rack seemed easy to use as well as being able to carry 3 bikes. I have not been disappointed in the least. The Hollywood bike rack installs in about 5 min. just strap it on, mount your bike tighten your strap good and tight, tie your bikes down and go. I made a 200 mile trip with it on the back of my car with no trouble at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie OKeefe

customer_reviews.title: Works for my bikes
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good bike mount that I could use on a car or SUV. This one works on either. It's easy to mount and dismount and does a great job of holding the bikes. The ends are padded and won't scratch the surface of the trunk. But I would have like to have seen some padding around the legs & arms that come close to the trunk. You need to be careful when you mount the rack that the arms and legs don't rub against the trunk and scratch the paint. I've wrapped duck tape around those areas as a precaution.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product does not fit a Ford Taurus (2002). The rack is very heavy and would have scratched the heck out of my car due to the incorrect proportions. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: booksmart81

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This rack works just as advertised. It is easy to install and adjust to however many bikes you're hanging on it (1-3.) I've fitted kids bikes and adult mountain bikes, all with non-standard frames and they fit fine. It folds flat and is easy to store, although it is on the heavy side. The straps are longer than needed, you can trim them to suit your needs. I'm using it on a Toyota Highlander and it fits just right.
customer_reviews.author: M A G

product_meta.title: Hollywood Racks Express Trunk Mounted Bike Rack
product_meta.description: The Express 2 is an economical three bike trunk rack. Fits most vehicles with easy-to-use adjustment tubs and six attachment straps. Soft rubber bike cradles help protect bike's finish. Comes fully pre-assembled and folds flat for easy storage. Features: Easy to adjust Will not damage your vehicle Pre-assembled 3-bike trunk rack with user-friendly hub adjustment system Soft cradles help protect bike finish; comes pre-assembled Integrated tie-down strap for extra security on the road Designed to fit perfectly on any type of vehicle Folds flat for easy storage; limited lifetime warranty
feature_bullets: Rubber bike cradles and EPDM rubber straps hold up to 2 bikes firmly in place;
Comes fully pre-assembled; Folds flat for easy storage in your trunk or garage
Max Capacity: 35lbs per bike; Not to be used for E-Bikes
Kids bikes and ladies frame bikes may require top tube adapter to fit on the rack
Check vehicle Fitguide to ensure the rack will work for your vehicle

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
